metadata.name: App Service Environments
metadata.description: This module deploys an App Service Environment.
Required. Name of the App Service Environment.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Resource tags.
Optional. Kind of resource.
Optional. Custom settings for changing the behavior of the App Service Environment.

Optional. Enable the default custom domain suffix to use for all sites deployed on the ASE. If provided, then customDnsSuffixCertificateUrl and customDnsSuffixKeyVaultReferenceIdentity are required. Cannot be used when kind is set to ASEv2.

Conditional. The URL referencing the Azure Key Vault certificate secret that should be used as the default SSL/TLS certificate for sites with the custom domain suffix. Required if customDnsSuffix is not empty. Cannot be used when kind is set to ASEv2.

Conditional. The user-assigned identity to use for resolving the key vault certificate reference. If not specified, the system-assigned ASE identity will be used if available. Required if customDnsSuffix is not empty. Cannot be used when kind is set to ASEv2.
Optional. The Dedicated Host Count. If `zoneRedundant` is false, and you want physical hardware isolation enabled, set to 2. Otherwise 0. Cannot be used when kind is set to ASEv2.
Optional. DNS suffix of the App Service Environment.
Optional. Scale factor for frontends.

Optional. Specifies which endpoints to serve internally in the Virtual Network for the App Service Environment. - None, Web, Publishing, Web,Publishing. "None" Exposes the ASE-hosted apps on an internet-accessible IP address.
Optional. Number of IP SSL addresses reserved for the App Service Environment. Cannot be used when kind is set to ASEv3.
Optional. Frontend VM size. Cannot be used when kind is set to ASEv3.
Optional. Property to enable and disable new private endpoint connection creation on ASE. Ignored when kind is set to ASEv2.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. Property to enable and disable FTP on ASEV3. Ignored when kind is set to ASEv2.
Optional. Customer provided Inbound IP Address. Only able to be set on Ase create. Ignored when kind is set to ASEv2.
Optional. Property to enable and disable Remote Debug on ASEv3. Ignored when kind is set to ASEv2.
Optional. Specify preference for when and how the planned maintenance is applied.
Required. ResourceId for the subnet.
Optional. User added IP ranges to whitelist on ASE DB. Cannot be used with 'kind' `ASEv3`.

Optional. Switch to make the App Service Environment zone redundant. If enabled, the minimum App Service plan instance count will be three, otherwise 1. If enabled, the `dedicatedHostCount` must be set to `-1`.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to '' to disable log collection.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed. If left empty, it defaults to "<resourceName>-diagnosticSettings".

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Conditional. The name of the parent Hosting Environment. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Property to enable and disable new private endpoint connection creation on ASE.
Optional. Property to enable and disable FTP on ASEV3.
Optional. Customer provided Inbound IP Address. Only able to be set on Ase create.
Optional. Property to enable and disable Remote Debug on ASEv3.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the configuration.
The resource ID of the deployed configuration.
The resource group of the deployed configuration.
Conditional. The name of the parent Hosting Environment. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Enable the default custom domain suffix to use for all sites deployed on the ASE.
Required. The URL referencing the Azure Key Vault certificate secret that should be used as the default SSL/TLS certificate for sites with the custom domain suffix.
Required. The user-assigned identity to use for resolving the key vault certificate reference. If not specified, the system-assigned ASE identity will be used if available.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the configuration.
The resource ID of the deployed configuration.
The resource group of the deployed configuration.
Required. Name of the private endpoint resource to create.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Required. Resource ID of the resource that needs to be connected to the network.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Required. Subtype(s) of the connection to be created. The allowed values depend on the type serviceResourceId refers to.
Optional. The private DNS zone group configuration used to associate the private endpoint with one or multiple private DNS zones. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone resource IDs. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The name of the private endpoint.
The location the resource was deployed into.
Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
The resource ID of the App Service Environment.
The resource group the App Service Environment was deployed into.
The name of the App Service Environment.
The location the resource was deployed into.
